review: I wanted to leave a review to show support and hopefully encourage others to give it a try. I‚Äôve played through a lot of dating simulators and Winked is by far the best. It‚Äôs well written and even though the answers are pre-written, you still feel like an actual participant when communicating/engaging with your matches. The available matches are diverse and have great back stories. It isn‚Äôt just about hooking up, boring conversation, and unnecessary drama for the sake of keeping things ‚Äúinteresting‚Äù. It is obvious the developers care about this app and us as the player because the conversations and dates are stimulating, fun, and inclusive. If you do decide to spend your diamonds (or don‚Äôt because you can get extended scenes, rewards, etc. without paying), the content/conversation is worth it. On that same note, even if you don‚Äôt pay to load up on extra diamonds or choose not to spend diamonds on outfits, content, pictures, etc.), your relationships still progress. I‚Äôm big into RPG‚Äôs and Simulators and as far as a mobile simulator, Winked is pretty much unmatched. Also, the developers are very friendly, quick to respond, and always helpful. Seeing the app progress is exciting and I can‚Äôt wait to see it unfold. Thanks Nanobit!
title: Best Dating Simulator!!! Love it.

review: The app is kinda glitchy. Not super, and there is no ads so I can‚Äôt complain there. But I think after a week of using it, I can give a fair review. 1.) if you don‚Äôt know, some of the characters have the same stories as each other. Such as Kaitlyn and Aniyah. However, when matching with Aniyah and heading on a date with her, I find that Kaitlyn‚Äôs character is there with her name rather than Aniyah‚Äôs character and name. Which, it‚Äôs not a big deal and doesn‚Äôt make a big difference story wise (obviously because it‚Äôs the same story) it just throws you completely out of the moment. If it were just that glitch I experienced, I wouldn‚Äôt be make a review. However‚Ä¶ 2.) the only reason this rating is as low as it is. I made an in-app purchase. I know, I have no shame (and I don‚Äôt care üòù) I have actually made several purchases. And the only one that hasn‚Äôt worked was my most recent. I made a purchase of $10 (roughly) and the money charged my account. HOWEVER, I don‚Äôt have my heart gem whatever thing-a-ma-bobs. And like, it‚Äôs only 10 bucks. But I expect an app that is charging me to allow me to view content, to actually give me the items I buy. That is the only reason why I can‚Äôt give this app a full 5 stars. If someone else experiences this, or multiple people do, it‚Äôs frustrating. And I sincerely hope that the developers care enough to fix this issue. And I would like to be either refunded or given my gems. Otherwise, I love the app ‚ù§Ô∏è

Claim button, to ‚Äúcash out‚Äù and stop playing wouldn‚Äôt work so I kept spending gems when I got the card that can cause you to lose. No big deal. Customer support says to me, after reopen the crashed game and find neither my diamonds nor the rewards are there, that there is nothing wrong on their end but here‚Äôs 150 diamonds as a convenience. All I wanted was the rewards, I‚Äôm fine with spending the money, took a screen shot to send and everything when the claim button through 40 something rounds wasn‚Äôt working. review: I was very excited when the ‚ÄúPerfect Match‚Äù mini game was first introduced. I thought it was a great way for players to get gems without having to purchase them. Being able to get ten gems for every round you won, and therefore up to 100 gems a day if you won every round, was a game changer, it made me actually want to play the game again considering I could actually afford to. Now it‚Äôs only five gems a round and only fifty seconds to complete the matching game, versus the previous sixty. Now the game is too difficult for what it‚Äôs worth. If they had dropped the time but kept the prizes the same I would‚Äôve been fine with it, but the dropped how much you can win as well. This just tells me they got scared of people using the game for diamond mining and decided to put their selfishness on full display by dropping the reward. I‚Äôve thought that the developers for this game were selfish for a while, but that ‚ÄúPerfect Match‚Äù was a step in the right direction, but I was wrong. There is nothing about this app that makes spending actual money on it worth it, and how the developers act makes it even less likely that I‚Äôll give them my real money again, and I regret spending any money I already have. Play the game if you want, the matches are enjoyable sometimes, but don‚Äôt give them your real money, it‚Äôs not worth it.
title: Selfish

review: UPDATE: I dropped the rating down to three stars from four stars. I‚Äôm not sure if you hit a plateau with matches, but the past couple of ones that I have ‚Äúliked‚Äù have not shown up in the chat. Also, you have to basically ghost a match for them to ‚Äúunmatch‚Äù from you. I feel like there should be a simpler way to remove someone front your chat. Original review: This is a fun app; however, one of my major complaints would be sometimes the matches that you like don‚Äôt show up in the chat. This has happened to me three times so far. I‚Äôve had the app for about a week or so. Also, I wish there was a feature to unmatch with a character if you‚Äôre not feeling the storyline. Lastly, as others mentioned with purchasing items likes clothes‚Ä¶they can really add up. There should be a feature within the dates to use clothing items you have already purchased. I‚Äôve seen the same premium options in a couple of different dates, and it makes you purchase it again for a new date even if you purchased it for a different date. review: The rewards do not come close to matching the cost. In another similar app that I regularly spend money on story choices go from 7-14 coins outfits are permanent buys at 25- video recordings at 25- and picture reveals at 33. Now it doesn't matter what the amounts are the rewards on this similar app is if you're a VIP member every five hours you get 10 coins every hour you can play three advertisements for five coins each for a total of 15 coins and every day that you login you receive six coins on the first day of the week and 50 coins on the last day of the week. Now your daily task run anywhere from two coins five coins and 10 coins, and every chapter you finish, you get between 6 to 30 coins based on how far in the story you are and how much you've already spent. but that's not when you really collect coins. I don't mind paying the VIP on this one or even at times buying extra coins because the rewards that they give for free match that of the choices more often than not. With you charging 200 more for each choice but only giving rewards of 10 you're not matching what's being spent for someone playing VIP just saying.
title: Way too expensive

review:
Update: I realized another issue. When playing the mini matching game there seems to be a lag in the tiles flipping over causing time to continue to run. I have the most updated version of the app as well as a new updated device. Is there a fix for this? 

I‚Äôm going to start by saying, I wish I had read the reviews before I downloaded or even purchased my first diamonds. With that said, the game is fun. It‚Äôs intriguing, the storylines pull you in. It‚Äôs entertaining at best. However, there is one main thing that needs work. That is the cost of the gems/diamonds and how many gems it costs per challenge/date/clothes/hair/response etc. It is honestly outrageous. Like someone said you‚Äôre literally paying $1 per 100 gems. It‚Äôd be different if this were a one off but majority of the reviews say the same thing. It‚Äôs expensive to keep up. It seems as though the developers don‚Äôt care because they don‚Äôt address the issues other than saying please email us your feedback. I would love to continue to play this game but the cost is keeping me from it.

review:
I use this app everyday, and I truly enjoy it. Great match selection, interesting stories, etc. My biggest issue is that, while new match characters are added, the older ones aren‚Äôt updated quickly enough, leaving players ghosted and waiting for updates. I‚Äôm sitting on four storylines that haven‚Äôt been touched in *months*, one of which (Edward) has to be near completion. What‚Äôs the ultimate goal for these chats? I would enjoy the app MUCH more if I could finish the storyline I started before rematching and starting again, rather than trying to remember where I was in a conversation with a match 6 months after the last update and between other matches. 

On that note, another necessary and helpful tool would be to include an upwards scrolling arrow for chats.  The downward arrow is helpful, but these chats get LONG, it takes forever to scroll to the top of the conversation, and the app bugs and closes when you get close to the top. I want to reread! Please make this easier to do.

review: I like this game and I really want to keep playing but agree with others that the gems are overvalued. The basic exchange rate is 100 gems=$1. I paid 400 gems for a ‚Äúvideo‚Äù that was nothing more than a slightly animated illustration, there was no voice component, etc. I paid the price of a cup of coffee for a drawing of a girl in a bikini tilting her head slightly. That‚Äôs it. Then almost $3 to choose an outfit for my character to go on a date. I would happily pay $20 for a month of unlimited gameplay but the way its set up currently it would literally cost hundreds of dollars to play through storylines with a couple matches which is INSANE. Agree with the other person who experienced that the option to watch videos for coins or earn them through surveys (that option was a scam anyway, never got my rewards) disappeared once I purchased gems. This is otherwise a great game and its a shame its not more realistically priced, because I‚Äôm going to have to abandon it.
title: Too expensive to keep up with

review: I really want to like this game and play it, but the cost of diamonds is ridiculous! To only get 10 ‚Äúfree‚Äù ones (you have to watch an ad) every 10 HOURS?! Is so stupid imo I just watched an ad and got the 10 free ones the next time I can is in 18!!! HOURS! You need over 100 to do anything fun in the game i.e clothes, pictures, voices or choices on dates. To spend real life money is absurd for a game I get that the game makers have to make money somehow but c‚Äômon give your players a way to win more and more often and lower the value of the player options 250 diamonds for a dress or a choice in the storyline is crazy, especially since you couldn‚Äôt even get that in a day without spending some serious money in real life. All in all it is a fun little experience for what you can actually play with the diamonds. But once you‚Äôre out you‚Äôre stuck with lame options of basically leaving your date or showing up in a basic outfit/ hairstyle and your date isn‚Äôt fun anymore. Game makers do better to let people actually play your game or people aren‚Äôt going to play it anymore‚Ä¶.
title: Such a scam!

review:
First of all, I love this game. It‚Äôs well done and it keeps your interest. I like how you are able to customize yourself to a certain degree, although the style/backgrounds are shared with the developers other games that doesn‚Äôt really bother me too badly. 

This is what I have an issue with. 

In order to actually choose options that progress your relationship, view pictures/photos/videos and hear voice messages it takes over 200 gems. 200. Per item. Per choice. 

You get 45 gems a day for free. That‚Äôs it. 

You get 10/20 gems for going on a date/leveling up. That‚Äôs it. 

When I first started playing I had an option to watch videos for a few extra free gems a day. Was it a lot?  No. Was it helpful? Eh.  But!! That option when away as soon as I made a purchase in game. ü§® so I emailed and was told that it was based on my location/time of day. So I downloaded the game on another phone- same kind of phone. Same location.  Same day/time. That one still gets free videos, but the one where I made a purchase has never seen another free video since.  üò° I don‚Äôt mind spending money on games that I enjoy, but I don‚Äôt like feeling like a game is basically unplayable without doing so. And I especially don‚Äôt like my free gems vanishing simply because I made a purchase at one point. 

That aside, a vip/monthly subscription that boosts rewards/gems might get me back into playing.  It‚Äôs just not a sustainable game to play without spending $$$$ to see all of the content.

review:
TLDR: expect to have stories not make sense and miss major plot points. 

I‚Äôve been playing with Damon hunt. I‚Äôve been religious about playing the mini games, watching adds, and have even done offers and spent money to complete those offers all in order to gain gems. I realized early on you miss a lot of things if you don‚Äôt use your gems so early on playing with Damon I made sure I picked special dialogues while texting and extended every date we have! I was having fun, the story was fun and exciting and then all the sudden out of nowhere Damon says that the best day of his life was proposing to me‚Ä¶WHAT PROPOSAL??? All the extended dates, all the special dialogues and that literally never happened? Completely took me out of the story and I don‚Äôt want to go along with Damon anymore and now I‚Äôm left regretting every gem I spent on him. I wish I could get my gems back and put them into someone else but who knows if that will happen again with another person? That‚Äôs a HUGE chuck to a storyline to just omit especially when I‚Äôm doing everything I can to get as much of the story as possible. Huge bummer, super disappointed

review:
At first, the idea of this game was very intriguing and it sucked me in big time. Unfortunately, there are some issues with this. It seems that once you get so far into one match storyline, there is no way to continue communicating. It makes you wait for the match to ‚Äúget back online‚Äù. This seems to take forever. I assume it‚Äôs because they have to make more content for that match.
Second, there seems to be a bug that glitches every now and then. You‚Äôll be in the middle of a conversation or a date and the app will restart right in the middle. When it comes back, you can‚Äôt continue the conversation or date because they end up being offline again. 
They need to fix the bugs. There should be more diamonds given when you advance in your romance. 10-20 is not enough to keep up with the demand of achievements needed to match with more people. 
It makes you want to just delete the app after a while, which I may end up doing.
title: It‚Äôs fun at first

review: I really love the conversations and the characters. There are tons to say the least. I do the like the variety and the back stories of each. I would like to make a suggestion in the diamonds area. Definitely can get expensive if you are addicted. But once an outfit is purchased could it just be in your ‚Äúcloset‚Äù for all your dates. I find purchasing the same outfit for a different character a waste. But because I want the characters to succeed I have purchased the outfit or whatever was needed. It would be cool to earn more diamonds in other ways. I love that there are no ads! It‚Äôs been a fun game. I do like that you don‚Äôt lose points on your meter if you can ‚Äútalk‚Äù or play the game every second of the day. I usually have to wait until I am home from work. So thank you for all your hard work.
title: New to this

review:
This dating simulator is so well written and there are so many different stories to play through. Overall, it‚Äôs an amazing game! The only reason I won‚Äôt give it 5 stars is because it‚Äôs frustrating that you have to repurchase the same premium outfits and hairstyles to boost your ‚ÄúDate Score‚Äù. If I already own the outfit or hairstyle, I shouldn‚Äôt have to ‚Äúrepurchase‚Äù it for the higher score. I think it takes away from the added benefit of purchasing premium items in the dirt place. I would rather spend gems on the premium date options. Every time I go on a date and see an outfit or hairstyle I‚Äôve already purchased for one date, I don‚Äôt want to spend the same amount for something I already own. I‚Äôd rather continue to build my collection of outfits and hairstyles.
Please fix this in the game.

review:
I love thissss game!!! I love almost everything about this game!!! Honestly, it‚Äôs the best role play story game on here. The only problem I have is the money/gems. Before I begin to explain I‚Äôm well aware that the relationships still progress even if you don‚Äôt spend gems. 

1. I think the gem packs are too expensive or that things in the game are too expensive.

2. There should be a better way to earn gems at least. Besides watching ads and paying for them. Maybe puzzles or mini games or something! 

3. If you do buy a hair or outfit you should be able to ‚Äúown‚Äù the outfit and be able to pick it out to wear instead of buying it again‚Ä¶ üòê I changed my avatar to have curly hair, and in one date the one with the highest rate was 90 gems‚Ä¶ and it was the same hairstyle I had but it didn‚Äôt count the points the same or anything. 

The gems are my main problem with the game. I really do love it! But the amount things cost.. it can be discouraging because you don‚Äôt get to experience those fun parts of the game unless you spend real money. It seems a bit unfair. And I might uninstall because of it! Maybe make people buy the game or something if you are wanting money.  Hopefully, the developers care about what people think and change the game around some!

review: The characters and stories are fun to play with but there‚Äôs just one problem‚Ä¶why are unfinished character storylines released? It‚Äôs so frustrating when I spend so much time on a character and then I find out their story isn‚Äôt finished leaving me frustrated that I spent so much time on nothing. Along with that, why are there such little gem rewards but such expensive gem options? review:
I would give this game 5 stars because the characters and storylines are genuinely great. However, the gem system is extremely frustrating. Most choices cost over 200 gems, yet you only earn 10‚Äì20 gems per character level-up, which takes forever without buying premium options. On top of that, ads only give 10 gems, while outfits cost 180 gems, and dates require another 200. How does that make any sense?

I understand the need to make money, but this feels plain greedy. It‚Äôs disappointing because this game has the potential to surpass others like Episode, but the monetization model holds it back. You literally cannot progress without spending money. I know this review probably won‚Äôt change anything, but I wanted to express how frustrating it is in retrospect.

To be honest you guys don‚Äôt deserve 4.6 stars, maybe 2 on a good day. If you look at this logically, this is a bad game. Guys go play Episode at least they make it easier now for you to get gems.

review:
This is a pretty good dating sim. It has decent writing and nice art style. I like the date meter for when you‚Äôre out on a date and it makes purchasing different outfits feel worthwhile.

However it does have a pretty pushy time limit for engaging with your matches. If you‚Äôre trying to stock up on gems to get good dialogue choices, unlock audio and visuals or have good dates it takes a long time. Which I wouldn‚Äôt mind but if you do this chances are your matches will unmatch you which is a frustrating.

The biggest blow against it is that as far as I can tell they haven‚Äôt added new content to the game in ages. It‚Äôs been ‚Äúbug fixes and improvements.‚Äù Monthly for a year with no patch notes about more content. I know my finished stories haven‚Äôt been updated.

review:
I love the gameplay, but I feel like they are literally trying to rob you with the amount that they charge for gems for every decent decision you can make in the game. I really wish they had a monthly subscription, even if it had different levels to it how much you pay for certain content. 

I just feel like in a day for me to spend 1500 to 2000 gems to go on a few dates and pick a few outfits is excessive considering 2000 gems is a little under $20. I was spending the money at first, but then realized how ridiculous this was so I guess I won‚Äôt be playing as much and I will send one message a day to keep my matches from unmatching me and save up on the free gems to afford to do something decent either an outfit or otherwise. 

Once again, either do a monthly subscription or lower. The amount of gems needed to make good decisions substantially. That is how you can improve the game.

review:
I am enjoying the game and like having the option to earn gems by watching ads. However, for the ads that you are forced to watch without earning anything, there are so many ads that it takes away from the gameplay. I can‚Äôt even switch from one chat to another without having to watch an ad. 

Furthermore, the ads are long and glitchy and after watching, you have to click in so many different areas on the screen to close the popups it that it‚Äôs turning me off from playing the actual game. 

Finally, the cost to chose some of the in game options is unreasonable. 250 gems for an outfit? 150 gems to ask certain questions? 300 gems to see a picture or hear a robotic sounding audio message? You can‚Äôt earn gems fast enough to afford these prices, so the game is trying to force you to use actual money to buy pretend gems. I have other simulation games where I can choose options such as clothing or choices or actions for as low as 15 gems. Check out your competition! 

I would love if the developers could add an option to pay for ad-free play. I would pay!

Some of the statements are lame like ‚ÄúI checked my mail today‚Äù and it gives you an option to üî•or ‚ù§Ô∏è.  Some right swipes won‚Äôt start a chat with that person for some reason. I really like the Angel/Devil game. That‚Äôs a real nail biter. This game has a lot of potential.
title: Almost 5 stars

review:
No thanks. Deleted the app. To get a full story you need to spend hundreds of dollars. Literally hundreds. 

Not to mention there isn‚Äôt a choice for steamy stories instead of straight porn. 

Kids download and read this stuff. There‚Äôs no way to protect them. 

It started out fun - I could unmatch the nasty ones and keep the pg-13 dates if I wanted - but the game crashed multiple times a minute. A MINUTE.

Diamonds are necessary to continue to story (or complete parts of it, or interact the way you want), and sometimes because of glitches they aren‚Äôt awarded properly when you earn them by leveling up in relationship. 

Purchases are always successful tho. Of course.

Tried to get customer service for diamonds I earned but wasn‚Äôt awarded after another crash. I was told by Nanobit to give them a detailed description of my problem in English. The original message was in English - in detail. Um‚Ä¶what?

They followed up saying they hadn‚Äôt heard from me so they closed the case as resolved - no diamonds for me. But they successfully scammed $50+ from me. 

Never again. 

I deleted the app, and I won‚Äôt be returning. I‚Äôd have more fun reading a book. Way cheaper too.
title: Sub Par Soft Porn with Many crashes and glitches.

review: I have enjoyed playing this app and think the storylines are great however recently whenever I try to buy diamonds, it pays for them and then glitches causing my app to exit out and when I restart the app all my diamonds are gone. This has happened twice already. The first time when I reached out to the developer‚Äôs support team they had to manually give me my diamonds but the second time they haven‚Äôt been very willing and haven‚Äôt really been answering me. I‚Äôve sent them screenshots of my apple receipts but I still haven‚Äôt heard back from them or got my diamonds back. Don‚Äôt waste your money on here. This might happen to you and the support team may treat you the same way.

review:
The great has a great concept with diverse characters, in depth backgrounds, good conversations and the art is amazing. I got 1000 gems free when I signed up. 

HOWEVER

It costs a lot of gems to play this game. 300 to unlock photos, 400 for video, 309 for 7 additional matches or you can wait 30 min for one new match, 250 for premium outfits (you must chose a new one for each date). The amount you make back in achievements barley covers what you spend. 30 gems to start the conversation with your match. 

If they lowered the cost of the gems or added ways to get gems without buying this game would be great. 

All these games where you‚Äôre playing a ‚Äúrole‚Äù are highly expensive with little reward. 

Do the dev ever think about that or are they looking for fat paychecks from these games? Do they even read these reviews and consider changes or just wait for people to buy gems?

If not, credits should be refundable for not being able to continue with chosen characters.

review:
First off, this app is a lot of fun, especially if you are a reader like I am and enjoy some light, smutty romance. 
It‚Äôs tasteful, engaging, and much better than the competitors. However, it is just as bad as the competition when it comes to the cost. 
Basically, the option to make the decision that you want is behind a paywall, and the other option is some far out response that even the least socially conscious people wouldn‚Äôt dare select. 
I did purchase some gems and enjoyed deliberating when to use them, it was worth it to me at the time. And they are probably banking on people having the same experience that I did. 
But it‚Äôs not sustainable. 
Without some sort of subscription or unlimited monthly option, this app is fun for a while and will eventually become obsolete for everyone who uses it.

review:
Although this is entertaining, I give it 3 stars for 3 main reasons:

1. You can‚Äôt type what you really want. So it‚Äôs childishly unrealistic. It forces you to say things no real person would. At least allow some input, add-ons. 

2. The character creation also needs updating. Can we get some realistic looking characters and of different sizes too?! All these love/dating game apps have characters of all one size. Allow us to have fun and build the body, face, and hair. Not everyone has long straight hair and pointy noses. 

3. Lastly, what‚Äôs with the constant paying and not being able to finish games?? Can their be more things to allow us to earn diamonds since that‚Äôs all we spend?? 

My main gripes. Just saying.

review:
Updating this review to why I‚Äôm deleting this game. It was fun, and I even spent real money to get through some storylines. But its VERY expensive. 
And now I‚Äôm getting zero new matches as well. I get that it‚Äôs supposed to be a ‚Äúdating simulator‚Äù but if I wanted to get ignored by fictional men I‚Äôd just get back on Tinder for free. 

I‚Äôd say don‚Äôt bother, or at least don‚Äôt spend your money on it.  The interactions are very limited, the art is low-key ugly, and paying $4 for a ‚Äúvoice message‚Äù that doesn‚Äôt even work is dumb.

review:
I have been playing this game since Sunday and I must say I really like it so far, I have matched with 8 people and I really only truly can see myself with Aki Yung Character, Dorian or Nikolai those are my top 3 for sure. I wish the choices were not so expensive I also wish it were more realistic.

Update: After this month I will be deleting this app and I will no longer be spending my money on this game, I have been playing since May and by now almost all my favorite matches have greyed completely. There is no updates so there is no way to know if the characters will return, I hate that you are unable to unmatch people yourself, I have one particular match who hasn‚Äôt been on in almost 2 months. I am unable to match with anyone new, I also don‚Äôt like there are more Women available than Men I‚Äôm not interested in Women there should be an option to choose your dating preference, there should also be an option to Completely Start over with any matches you choose. I also notice this app is a money grab it is ridiculous how much money is required to play for this reason I stick to Episode, Choices Etc these apps have a subscription service that allows to play unlimited for the month and more FREE Options to choose from!!!

I feel sorry for those who have wasted so much time, this app is actually incomplete it‚Äôs not fair we have invested Our hard earned Cash into something so half done. Why are the story lines NOT Complete? Why do matches go ghost at 50% sometimes less than that? Two of my matches I had Just started interacting With they made it to 18% then over unacceptableüò°Fix the Prices, Complete the Stories then maybe I‚Äôll consider returning!!!
title: Pros & Cons!!!

review: Literally the best dating storyline simulator game I‚Äôve come across‚Äî the writing is amazing and the characters are mostly all unique. I love the option to watch ads a day for free gems (but once you make a purchase the ads are gone- so watch out). And they hardly update the female matches. Other updates are slow, as well. But I do like how you can customize your own character (although even if you buy outfits, you can‚Äôt wear them on other dates; that should be changed as well, because it makes users not wanna buy date outfits, as much.) & it would also be cool to customize our dates. Lastly, they barely give you any time before the characters unmatch you. IMO, that‚Äôs stupid because not everyone has time to play daily or even access, especially with no wifi signal, like if you‚Äôre out on a cruise/boat. Normally it‚Äôs supposed to be 24 hours, but I‚Äôve experienced a glitch where I was unmatched just hours after texting back and I had to reach out to customer service to fix it. Granted, CS is pretty on point & will usually reimburse for issues, but they take a while to reply and you have to end up spending 250 gems just to get progress back, or choose to start all over. Without those negative qualities of the app, it could easily be 5 stars. Please, creators, we need these things fixed! I‚Äôve heard so many complaints about it and some people are switching over to other apps because of it. STOP the automatic unmatching feature! Give people time to play. We have lives. We love Winked, but do better, we beg of you! ‚Äî side note: if y‚Äôall could make the characters have motion and move, laugh, kiss like the ones do on Episode, that would be even more amazing.
title: Has potential but the times auto-unmatching is a bummer

review: I am a bit disappointed in the limited options in conversations; most of the interaction seems to be a preprogrammed response, rather than being able to direct the conversation to a certain extent.  I realize it's a game and more options means more programming but i just started playing recently and have already unmatched someone because the conversation started going down a road (talking about a hobby from my side) that i had no interest in and had no choice in. I also have just had to say a comment in the conversation about a hobby that i would never say so i wish there again that there were more options for how the conversation could go.   Also, if this really is simulating a dating app, then more options need to be programmed in for the matches available.  For example, i would be looking for a man in real life.  I have no interest in women.  I've declined about 5 women in the 12 hours i've been playing.  If the number of matches is limited anyway, then it would make more sense to at least have that filter in there for who you want to interact with.  My first date also had the wrong avatar the whole time.  It was supposed to be Matt, and in the conversation it was Matt but the man himself was labeled as Noah and the picture was nothing like Matt.  It was correct on the second date.  I almost ended the first date because of the wrong imagery.     I will probably keep playing for the time being to see where it goes, but i have not been super impressed so far.
title: Needs more conversation options

review:
I really enjoy Winked, especially the depth the devs put in to the stories, dates and images.  Each story and character has a unique feel, though maybe not super unique sprites.  In the short time I‚Äôve been playing, I‚Äôve already seen the update of more customizable sprites, the addition of the daily game, character updates plus new characters added, more images and voice files, plus the fun unavailable matches they throw in that have turned in to new characters down the road.  Sure, the gem choices can be a bit pricey, but the daily game gives so many prizes and gems that it‚Äôs really become quite easy to get the higher priced features.  

My only big complaint at this time is the auto match feature.  I don‚Äôt want to be auto matched with the new characters, I want the choice to match with the character I choose.  And with no way to switch between counterparts (a feature that Winked is missing compared to an alternative game of similar nature), there are now characters I have zero desires to chat with.  Just today, I missed out on being able to match with Massimo, a character I have been waiting anxiously for since his profile was first introduced as unavailable, and was automatically matched with his counterpart, Daniel.  As such, poor Daniel will be completely ignored by my MC all because he‚Äôs not the one character I‚Äôve been wanting for so long.  Until this feature of auto matching changes, I can‚Äôt give the game a higher review.  It really kills the fun and excitement of new matches.
title: Auto Match is ruining the fun of new matches

review:
I see yall don‚Äôt want me to rate & that‚Äôs cool. But, I am. There should be more responses that we could use to respond to these dates. I know some ppl get into character w/ games like this but, some don‚Äôt & I don‚Äôt. Yall should take polls & ask us how we‚Äôd respond in certain scenarios. That way yall could have better options for us to choose from & yall can know how to make the date respond. Sometimes I want to be mad, be petty b/c they‚Äôve done or said the most absurd stuff. But, it‚Äôll be a ‚Äúno, I understand why you treated me like a dog. No we‚Äôre cool.‚Äù Like whaaa?! Or they have times where they‚Äôll have us just be completely rude b/c we didn‚Äôt spend a billion gems to pick the nice response. Also‚Ä¶.the game is very much so rated sexual in content. Yall have scenarios where there‚Äôs dates just abt being just for that. Which if I ever pick, I immediately un-match. & the other ones are supposed to be normal. Of course I expect it to get there. B/c it gets there irl lol! But, even those aren‚Äôt normal. If we don‚Äôt choose to go get it in, in the middle of a met gala then we‚Äôve disappointed our date & the lever never moves. Thats not weird?! So, then this entire game is just based off that one thing then right?!  Like the creator has some kind of secret fetish to doing things in public & getting caught. B/c I haven‚Äôt matched w/ one yet that hasn‚Äôt tried that same scenario! & here‚Äôs my thing‚Ä¶they‚Äôre always the ones to bring it up‚Ä¶but, you want me to pay 250 gems for it. & if I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..there‚Äôs not much progress. Like?!

The best part of the game is the mini games. But, they glitch! This is just a buy gems & lose em kind of a game. Match game the cards get stuck & the time runs out before you can realize what‚Äôs happened. & game of love‚Ä¶it‚Äôs my fav one. But, it feels just like gambling‚Ä¶b/c you get addicted but, you never win.

review:
I really love this game, and there has been many updates since the last time I reviewed in which I‚Äôd like to add on. I like that the amount of gems you earn when each level with matches goes up increased. I also love the addition of the ‚Äúgame of love‚Äù and I like the potential it serves‚ÄîHowever, chances of getting anything that‚Äôs of high quality in the game is really low. I‚Äôm more likely than not to choose the ‚Äúheartbreaker‚Äù card on my second chance: this being said I feel like beings we have to pay to be able to ‚Äòcontinue‚Äô playing that our chances of earning higher quality items should increase as well. May it be increasing the amount of higher quality options within the cards, or increasing the amount of cards in general. This way instead of there being a 1/4 chance of getting a heartbreaker card it‚Äôd be a 1/6, then a 1/8‚Äìidk it only seems fair that the chances of getting higher quality cards would increase when the amount of gems to continue increases each time, and we may end up with nothing at all. I also think that if we lose we should be able to collect everything we‚Äôd gotten, because even if we didn‚Äôt press the finish button we still had to spend our gems to get more chances to continue. I also wanted to point out how pricey ‚Äúpremium‚Äù choices are. From the initial ‚Äòdressing up‚Äô for the dates to the actual choices, it‚Äôs 500 gems a date, yet we only get 45-55 free gems a day. (The rewards gems aren‚Äôt ever granted either) If we have multiple matches we‚Äôre focused on and don‚Äôt want to miss out on what the premium choices unlock, it can take DAYS‚Äîliterally just to earn half of that with the free gems we get daily, and what little we get from the love game. To add on the dates and matches‚Äîbeings choices are pretty pricey I often exit dates and wait for days in order to build the amount of gems I have to pick the premium choices. With this the notifications about my matches unmatching me come pretty quickly, and when it happens you have to pay a lot to resume the story with them. I love how interactive this game is. I like how we‚Äôre able to customize characters, though we‚Äôre not able to choose a gender, and options for POC is lacking, I like that‚Äôs it‚Äôs offered. I also like how a previous suggestion from my former review was added when it comes to not having to pay for outfits we‚Äôve already bought with other dates and matches. The stories are great and I just adore the characters and their stories. Each one is unique and there‚Äôre often things that happen in them that I don‚Äôt quite expect. This is definitely one of my favorite interactive games, and love how you guys take your time updating and improving the game.

Most recent update: I really love this game, but it‚Äôs just too expensive. Wait times are crazy, and honestly the amount of gems that‚Äôs offered to pay for isn‚Äôt enough. Very disappointing that I‚Äôve been on and off of this game and after about of year of not playing, there still aren‚Äôt very many offered ways of getting more gems accessibly. Won‚Äôt be playing anymore.

review:
I do agree with everyone else that is saying this game is way to expensive.
you start off with 1000 hearts I believe right?.
Let's say you go on a date with one of you're matches and you decide to buy a cute outfit to impress you're date which is about 200 or more then you decide to buy a hairstyle which is about 60 or more.
While on the date you'll get to say stuff that makes you're match happier and makes the date better for you as well, but you have to spend some hearts in order to even say those things which are also very expensive like 200 or more.
Then after all that, you'll have the choice to continue the date or go home and to continue it cost about 500!!! Yayyyyy.
Which I doubt anyone would have enough hearts left after buying all those other things to make the date go perfectly well :).

There is no option to watch ads to get more hearts nor can we do surveys.

And I'm probably sure there is not one thing on this game that you can buy for 30 hearts.

and then we have to wait 23 hours which you guys can just say 24 hours, for 40 hearts that won't help us either.

I'm confused why do we have to wait almost a day just for 40 hearts when almost everything on the game cost more then 100 hearts???.

I'd rather wait a day for 200 hearts because that's more reasonable.

also a whole day we have to wait just for 40 hearts? Can you guys at least lower it down to 8 hours or even better just one hour.

This game definitely is money seeking and wants people to spend all their money.

But yes I enjoy playing the game and the only problem is how expensive it is üëçüèæ.

review:
First, I think the pics, audio, video, clothes, hair and comment choices should not cost as much as they do. You don‚Äôt allow us to earn enough in a 48 hour period to have these items cost as many diamonds as they do.  I get you need to make money, but your ratios are too expensive.  

Second, as others have commented, I should not have to waste swipes on same sex matches when my character is not lesbian or bi.  Please make this more customizable based on the player. 

Third, I agree with the commenter about more realistic conversation options. For instance, I won‚Äôt give away the match identity, but when my guy tells me he wants to spend most of his downtime with me and then proceeds to go out to bars 3 nights in a row‚Ä¶with no invitation for me to join him‚Ä¶my options shouldn‚Äôt be to tell him I‚Äôm just going to curl up with a book at home!  No my option should be to ask if I‚Äôm invited, or maybe to ask if he really meant it about spending time with me or is he just stringing me along.  This is my first time through this app, so perhaps this match is simply doomed to failure.  But after spending at least 3000 diamonds on this guy it‚Äôs more than a little disappointing.  It‚Äôs just a game, but when I‚Äôm spending some money on it I‚Äôd like a few more options to make it more realistic.

Otherwise, I enjoy the storylines, the art and the game overall.  It‚Äôd be great if there was a subscribe option with a monthly fee for diamonds or other ways to earn more diamonds each day.  Overall this is a unique app that I do like.

review: I really enjoy this game so far. It's engaging and you have many choices. You don't have to pick just one date to go on and you don't have to miss out. So fun and unrealistic(which is great).I have a few suggestions though..I know the developers put a lot of effort so you can't complain about the paid experiences..I just wish that the diamond points racked up a bit more..only 10 at a time in convos is a bit small. Well when you get them through achievements..it's kinda decent amounts at least. I also wish I was able to match with everyone..sometimes they don't like me back?! This is a game..it hasn't been realistic..but not everyone likes you? Irony lol.I wish your job could be chosen (in each convo)..I think only one convo let me choose between just two jobs. Since in every match you can have a different occupation. Also during convos ..you kinda don't have many choices sometimes..the two choices end up being the same actually.Lastly, the match game only gives you 5 points..and it's quite difficult and laggy to play.All this to say..the game is great, but I wish certain things were different. I haven't enjoyed a story game app besides one years ago.I have usually deleted them after just a couple of days. The artwork is also really good in this game. Thanks for reading.
title: Cool game!

review:
I actually love the stories and conversations it‚Äôs fun!

review: This is by far the best simulation game I‚Äôve ever downloaded, but it has some major (in my opinion) flaws. Can you progress with your matches without spending money? Yes. However, all of the best choices need gems to unlock them. Which is understandable. That‚Äôs how the app makes money, and I don‚Äôt mind spending a little money on an app that I love as much as this one. But gems are insanely expensive. For $5 you 500 gems. That‚Äôs basically only two ‚Äúpremium‚Äù choices. $100 (!!!???) would get you 15000 gems which would be 75 of those premium choices, and that‚Äôs if you don‚Äôt want to unlock pictures, videos, and aspirations to further a relationship. You also have the option to purchase outfits which boost relationship progress. I think I purchased 2 before I realized that you don‚Äôt get to ‚Äúkeep‚Äù these outfits. Though they may appear later to repurchase. The matches are a great idea, the variety of options for them is amazing, the storyline is impeccable, and if the gems were a little cheaper the premium choices would be very worth it. I get people who don‚Äôt want to spend money on an app, and even though it isn‚Äôt necessary for this app, as someone who likes spending extra for the special stuff, it‚Äôs frustrating that the prices are so inexcusably high.

title: eh..

review: Be prepared to pay if you want to enhance relationships. There is no doubt that this game is quality. The diversity in characters, details of the potential matches, graphics, storylines and even pre-written responses are all well thought out. It‚Äôs evident the developers have done their research and care about this product to have it in some ways model the feel of an actual dating app. However, the cost adds up to enjoy the game they way you want to and quickly. It feels as though once you make more than one purchase the system recognizes that you‚Äôre willing to spend money and the longer you‚Äôre in connection with matches the more you‚Äôre presented with options to spend more diamonds. For my storylines that have progressed the farthest, diamond responses pop up several times within a short stint of the conversation. Through a conversation I should not have to pay 120-250 diamonds just for one response several times. Especially if you are matched with multiple people and also want to enjoy features like a better outfit for a date or added experiences than can lead to bonus content. If you purchase diamonds you can spend $20 just for 2600 and they get used up so quickly just by either choosing a nicer outfit, extending a date or a simple response within a conversation. I understand this is a business and the developers need to generate revenue but imagine how quickly $20 can turn into $100 and so on. I would appreciate the game better if there were a third text response option that was maybe less expensive. Similar to how outfits worth 250 diamonds are premium and the lesser ones cost less. Return on investment is key. If you invest your money you want to know what you‚Äôre getting in return is worth it. And with some relationships moving at a slower pace than others you don‚Äôt want to feel like your money for diamonds is wasted. Options allows the user to feel like we can choose how engaged we want to be. But most of the time if you do not select a Diamond response, you‚Äôve missed out on an experience or gaining an aspiration to add to your collection. Also the photo/video/audio messages are extremely high priced. Especially when the audio message is nothing more than an extended text. There are no voices. Half the time you can skip paying for them and continue the conversation giving the impression you‚Äôve viewed an image or video just to hold on to your diamonds. While it may mean you miss out on collecting bonus diamonds for meeting milestones within the game but you have to weigh your options and use your diamonds strategically. Even if you visit the game daily and play the Game of Love to earn more, what you‚Äôre earning is still not enough to prevent you from having to invest a significant amount of money to enjoy the game to the fullest. Eventually you come to a crossroad where you ask yourself do I walk away or can I afford to keep paying.
title: Pay to Stay!

review:
For the most part I love this games but there are some things that definitely need improvement. First there has to be a bug or glitch with the swipe feature because I‚Äôve swiped right or pressed to heart and the profile goes away and I never match with the person. Secondly let‚Äôs talk gems it is extremely hard to earn gems sure your games can still progress but it makes it a little slow and boring. I noticed that watching ads for gems went away altogether after a few uses which was one of the things I depended on for gems. Now the ‚Äúfree‚Äù offers were annoying and should be eliminated altogether in my opinion you just end up at a dead end with time wasted. Third let‚Äôs talk about pricing of clothing and dates etc. absolutely ridiculous we‚Äôre talking 90-250 gems just to wear certain clothing or to progress with your match. Considering how hard it is to earn gems you guys have got to come down on the cost of things. Another thing the whole counterpart profiles are nice and all but I wish that instead of pretty much repeating the same stories things would changed a bit. Repeating everything makes it a bit boring and predictable. All in all I do enjoy the game but yeah those are a few things that could use improvement. 

Maybe in the future you guys could make a game that‚Äôs like a continuation of Winked like Winked: Ever After or Winked: Love at First Swipe where they are official and navigate a relationship and go through ups and down. Ending in marriage and kids or something. Just a thought lol.
